colors: Deep Violet With Vivid Jade  Pollen

descriptions.value: Giving a nod to old school style, these women's 574 trainers from New Balance are footwear classics. Originally a hybrid of two separate sneakers, these mashed up essentials have been making an impact ever since '88. Suede and mesh panelling to the upper keep the foot fresh and supported, while the 574's EVA Encap midsole delivers lightweight cushioning coated with polyurethane for added shock absorption. In an 'off white' colourway, they're finished with a solid rubber outsole for grippy traction every step of the way, as well as New Balance's world famous 'N' logo to the sidewalls.

value: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch

name: New Balance 574-WHITE-7

prices.shipping: 5% Off on all orders Use Code: SHOP5$14.99 delivery
Delivery by Sat, Jul 31 Spend $150 for free delivery

reviews.text: I love these shoes the colors are popping. I gave 3 stars because when the shoes arrived it was clear one shoe had been tried on and had obvious creases in them already. The tissue was balled up and torn. It's like the person handling online returns didn't even open the box. If I'm paying $100 plus for a pair of shoes I don't want to see creases in them. However, when u called customer service they were extremely helpful they said I could return the shoes to any store but unfortunately they don't sell NB in stores.. yay me!
reviews.title: Won't order online again

reviews.text: Just got these, was so excited. I thought the Core would be a better 574. Like the old WL574PBL that I've worn into the ground. Not close. I usually wear a W 9, go up 1/2 size for arch inserts. These, my toe is right at the top. They're just not comfortable at all, there's no arch support without an insert. And since these aren't in-store, I can't just try exchanging or returning to the store, very disappointed. Especially for the price. Will try on again a little later just in the apartment, but right now it looks like a return will be made. Picture is of my old beloved 574 that was discontinued
reviews.title: Runs small

reviews.text: I walk five days a week in these shoes. I ordered 877"s In a few months I wore a hole in the top of the shoe box. I really liked those shoes was very disappointed, they were very comfortable. After that I ordered 574's, size 6, they were actually tight. The heels (inside) are already getting holes in them! So I walked in them anyway, give them time to stretch. I then ordered the 574's in 6 1/2, they are better. You have to understand I started out with 505's that I still have but the soles are wore out, They are the best shoe!I have 6 other NB shoes in different colors that I wear all the time, with my jeans. Too bad you can't make a quality shoe like the 505's. I'm guessing they are pretty old, but a good shoe!

I have been searching for a new pair of running shoes for walking/biking as well the occasional run. These babies do not disappoint! They look great, are very supportive and so light. I have stubborn plantar fasciitis and these have been a dream!
reviews.title: Great Shoe!

reviews.text: First of all, I love the look of these shoes. They fit me perfectly. Unfortunately, they can be super painful when worn. I am not sure if this is due to the fact that they are still in the process of being broken in, but I received pretty bad blisters on the backs of my ankles after wearing them for only a couple of hours. The third time I wore the shoes they actually made my ankles bleed. I wore the sneakers with no show socks-looking back I probably should have worn taller socks- but I have never had this issue with any pair of sneakers before while wearing the same style of sock. Hopefully, this problem is resolved after breaking in the shoes. I am not sure if I would wear them to work out in as they seem to be more a fashion sneaker.
reviews.title: Love these shoes but NEED to be broken in!!

reviews.text: My favorite shoes I have owned!! I have had these shoes for 2 years and I wear them everyday. They are comfortable and work with everything I wear. In the two years I have had them, my feet never tire walking in them. I wear them to my job that requires me to be on my feet for hours and when travelling. The durability of them cannot be understated either. As I have said, I wear them everyday, and the shoes are still in great shape. Of course there is some wear and tear, but how they have held up is incredibly impressive.I LOVE these shoes!
reviews.title: Comfort and Style

reviews.text: First pair of New Balances I ever ordered. The shoe ran a little small, when I reached out to voice my concern with an online Representative they were open arms. They understood my concern and sent me a shipping label right away!!! I ordered the correct size along with another pair of New Balances I liked. They were dropped off at my front door in 3 days!!! Awesome experience and great shoes!!!
reviews.title: Great Purchase!!!
reviews.username: Doubler R · Review provided by  newbalance.com

reviews.text: I bought a pair of NB 997s last year in a 7.5. Bought these 574s in a 7.5… and they run small. They’re also visibly smaller when held up next to my other pair. Annoying that they changed their sizing. Going to try to exchange for a half size up. Otherwise they’re well made, color is true to website.
reviews.title: Runs small

reviews.text: I was doing a lot of walking because of the COVID pandemic, and I needed a nice pair of walking shoes to do it in. I did some research and found these sneakers. I took the advice on the LL Bean sizing info and ordered 1/2 size larger than my normal size 6. They fit perfectly and there was no break in period. They should not be worn with very thin socks but you don't have to do really thick either. I do recommend wearing socks with them. They look great and I haven't had any problems with them rubbing anywhere. I have done 2.5 hour hikes with no issues.
reviews.title: Great walking sneaker

reviews.text: The New Balance have great all day support. Stylish too. Receive many compliments on their design. I have back and knee issues, and on days I am running around and going up and down stairs, these saved me from a world of pain. My feet did not swell and did not hurt.
reviews.title: Comfy! Classic! AWESOME
reviews.username: The Beagle · Review provided by  dickssportinggoods.com

reviews.text: I've worn these shoes for about 2 week and find it very comfortable. My job involves some days where I have to stand for the entire shift and these shoes supported my flat feet well.They are true to size imo.However the pictures ASOS has makes the shoe appear lighter than it actually is. The New Balance site shows the true colour more. The shoe is made up of a suede like material and I've stained them already - stain is hard to remove.
reviews.title: Super comfortable shoes

reviews.text: I am really happy with these shoes. They are very comfortable, light weight, nice style, great color combination and an overall good value. I read many reviews about the sizing and how they felt small. I decided to ignore those reviews and ordered my usual size. I'm a pretty true size 6.5 and when there are only whole sizes I size up to a 7. I'm glad that I chose my usual (6.5) size because I think they fit very well but I suppose if you like to wear thick socks you could be better off going up half a size.
reviews.title: Great Shoes

reviews.text: I've worn these shoes for about 2 week and find it very comfortable. My job involves some days where I have to stand for the entire shift and these shoes supported my flat feet well.They are true to size imo.However the pictures ASOS has makes the shoe appear lighter than it actually is. The New Balance site shows the true colour more. The shoe is made up of a suede like material and I've stained them already - stain is hard to remove.
reviews.title: Super comfortable shoes

reviews.text: I was doing a lot of walking because of the COVID pandemic, and I needed a nice pair of walking shoes to do it in. I did some research and found these sneakers. I took the advice on the LL Bean sizing info and ordered 1/2 size larger than my normal size 6. They fit perfectly and there was no break in period. They should not be worn with very thin socks but you don't have to do really thick either. I do recommend wearing socks with them. They look great and I haven't had any problems with them rubbing anywhere. I have done 2.5 hour hikes with no issues.
reviews.title: Great walking sneaker

reviews.text: The New Balance have great all day support. Stylish too. Receive many compliments on their design. I have back and knee issues, and on days I am running around and going up and down stairs, these saved me from a world of pain. My feet did not swell and did not hurt.
reviews.title: Comfy! Classic! AWESOME

reviews.text: These were extremely comfy right out of the box. The insole is super cushy, but you still get a responsive step when you wear these. Although, I'm a little bit confused reading the other reviews. I am a tried and true 8.5, but occasionally I will get a 9 in brands like Nike where the shoe is narrow. Every other shoe I am an 8.5. I followed the advice of other reviewers here to size up and ordered both a 9 and 9.5. The 9 is great in terms of width but the length was a bit much. I knew I should have just gone with my regular size. I will be ordering an 8.5 just to make sure that is the correct fit before I return both of the larger sizes.
reviews.title: Order your normal size!!

reviews.text: I'm a devoted Adidas gal but could NOT get this colorway out of my head and have never owned a pair of New Balance. Umm so glad I tried these! I love how chic and stylish they are but the comfort is amazing! I initially bought for athleisure wear but ran in them and did some working out and wow, my feet love me. Also have gotten compliments on this pink color. I believe I'll be buying many more in this style. Timeless and always in style. I look cool too. 😎
reviews.title: Uhh Amazingly Comfortable

reviews.text: I have purchased New Balance women 574 for a few years. I normally wear a size 8.5 Standard. Unfortunately, I was ill and now I have a severe drop foot. Every single day for the rest of my life it is required I wear an AFO brace. This changed my gait, walking, using a cane and much more. My shoe size changed to a 9.5 WIDE. I have noticed there is a limited selection of women 574 WIDE sizes. (Maybe 2 or 3 styles)??? In boring colors. I have called the representatives from New Balance and seem to have a different answer each time. I have noticed the 574 women size for Standard are quite plentiful. I don't know why the WIDE size for women 574 is no longer available??? Please reconsider introducing the 574 WIDE in all colors and styles for women. They sell out quickly !
reviews.title: What happened to the word WIDE?????

reviews.text: I bought these shoes after reading that they are not true to size, but run big. Therefore I bought a half size smaller than usual. My usual size was not available, and so I could not order both sizes to try. I ordered the pink ones, and I liked how they looked. However, I I found that one foot felt comfortable, but the other did not at all--one toe was being pinched. I guess one of my feet is a little larger than the other, but most New Balance shoes fit me better than these. They have been returned, and the next half size was still not available for exchange.
reviews.title: Look good but not comfortable for me
reviews.username: Jill M. · Review provided by  altitude-sports.com

reviews.text: Buy a size up, I wear 6.5, bought 7 because I wear arch supports. You have to take out the removable original insole cushion thing to put your arch supports in or the shoe will feel like it's stabbing the top of your foot when you walk. It's a stiff type of shoe, which I need, but it's a chill look that goes with everything. Noice!
reviews.title: Nice, but if you wear arch supports, take out cushion first

reviews.text: I have been wearing a pair of New Balance 373's every day for the past three years. I wear them absolutely everywhere; I've gone hiking, swimming, running, tree-climbing, rock climbing, and all sorts of things the shoes aren't even meant for in these shoes! They're the most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever worn and I swore I would never buy another brand again. The treads finally got so worn down that I decided to buy another pair. When I came online, I found out that the 373 series had been discontinued. Multiple sources told me that the 574 series was released to replace it. I Googled the differences between these styles and was led to believe that the only substantial difference was the sole - the 574's are chunkier and have some plastic thing, but I was ok with that ... MoreI have been wearing a pair of New Balance 373's every day for the past three years. I wear them absolutely everywhere; I've gone hiking, swimming, running, tree-climbing, rock climbing, and all sorts of things the shoes aren't even meant for in these shoes! They're the most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever worn and I swore I would never buy another brand again. The treads finally got so worn down that I decided to buy another pair. When I came online, I found out that the 373 series had been discontinued. Multiple sources told me that the 574 series was released to replace it. I Googled the differences between these styles and was led to believe that the only substantial difference was the sole - the 574's are chunkier and have some plastic thing, but I was ok with that.When they came in the mail, I tried them on and before I even had the chance to look and see if I liked them, I immediately noticed a bad difference. Even though I had ordered the exact same size I had for my 373's, these didn't fit quite right and were tight in different places. Had I tried on this pair of shoes in a store, I would have taken them off and walked away based on fit alone. However, I put both shoes on and walked around, looking at them to see if they at least looked cute. If this is your style, that is totally fine, but I did not like them! While the 373 has a slightly tapered toe, the 574 is very very rounded and almost boxy, they reminded me of the Mary Jane style kid's shoes I used to wear to church as a toddler.This is long, so I apologize for that. There is a chance other people will love this shoe so I don't want to dissuade shoppers based on anything other than this: IF YOU ARE TRYING TO REPLACE YOUR 373 SERIES SNEAKERS, DO NOT BUY 574! Less
reviews.title: Was told these replaced the discontinued 373 style
reviews.username: Still Sneakerless · Review provided by  newbalance.com

reviews.text: I work in a medical clinic and wear scrubs, wanted something comfortable to wear all day but also in a darker color so it doesn't look too dirty over time. Got the navy color and it's perfect. Also cute enough to wear with a skirt or a dress after work. It fits true to size, if not a little smallerz. I'm a 6.5 in Nike Air Force/day breaks and I got a 7 in these.
reviews.title: Perfect for being on your feet all day at work

reviews.text: They take a long time to break in and they’re a small fit. I’m usually a 2.5 but could only get these in a 3, so I took the risk. The 3 was tight! Definitely wouldn’t have fit into my usual size. The backs also cut my heels pretty bad the first few times I wore them. They’re getting a bit softer, but still not comfortable as runners go. I’ve also had a few comments from people that my feet look strangely small when I wear them (haha) but I do like the colour variant, hence the few stars I gave them.
reviews.title: Really nice but small fit
reviews.username: Rachel V · Review provided by  asos.com

reviews.text: Asos Sizing recommended a size 11 for this shoe for my size, but I decided to go to an 11.5 just incase. However, when I tried them on they were way too short. I would say that a 12.5 would maybe fit a usual mens size 11. With Asos no longer offering exchanges I returned this item. Not impressed Asos... Sort your Sizing out with the shoe brands.
reviews.title: Looks great but Sizing is completely wrong!

reviews.text: Amazing product, love the look and feel and the fit was perfect, Altitude-sports seems to be working on improving its sizing charts which helps a lot choosing among all the footwear brands they offer. I can now measure my foot in a very easy way and pick the perfect shoe size. the true to size widgets helps also. Amazing experience !
reviews.title: Amazing product super comfortable
reviews.username: Joe A. · Review provided by  altitude-sports.com

reviews.text: Looks exactly what it is shown, it weighs lighter than I expected. Good fit, but sizing seems smaller than other brands due to the cutting? My feet is quite wide at the front, but no discomfort. Might need to size up if want to wear it with thicker socks. But so far so good. :)
reviews.title: My first pair of NB.

reviews.text: I think these shoes are cute/stylish in a sporty type way. Also, they make my feet look small (which I like). The only reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 is because they aren't the most comfortable. Not bad, but could a little more comfy. Also, I would say they run on the small side. I typically run somewhere between a 9 and a 9.5. I got a 9.5 and I'm glad I did, because there is no wiggle room!
reviews.title: Nice crossover shoe

reviews.text: I liked the style of this shoe. I ordered a size up because of some of the reviews on sizing. However, it wasn't the size (although slightly too big) it was the support. It felt flatter than other NB shoes. I've got some back trouble and ordered for casual style, but rather have a more supportive NB shoe and I found another that works better.
reviews.title: RETURNING

reviews.text: These shoes are quite comfortable. Bought them to travel in. Can wear these all day if I get the tongue of the shoe flattened. Every time I put these on the edges of the tongue fold under. If I dont notice it right away it causes uncomfortable pressure on the top of foot. Laying the tongue flat isn't always easy. Sometimes I have to take shoe off and wedge fingers on sides of tongue then try to slide shoe on. When I get it right, these shoes are great.
reviews.title: Comfortable if...

reviews.text: (late-September 2020) Something has happened at NB because I have other 574s in my size of 8.5M and they all fit great. I got these in 8.5M and when I took it out of the box I thought it looked like a child's shoe; just like an evil stepsister I literally could not get my foot all the way. I tried the 9M and my toe was pushed up against the very edge of the shoe -- still way too small. I am debating asking for an exchange for a 9.5M to see, but ...?My right foot is a supinator (rolls out to put pressure on the pinky side of the foot) and both feet have high arches. **In the past** my 574s have been great! But if I can't get the shoe on or if it's too short to comfortably, safely wear, then ... what does it matter.
reviews.title: teeny tiny!

reviews.text: I tried the grey color at a NB store and really liked the color. The only thing I had to take some time to think about prior to purchasing was the size. I usually wear Women's 7.5 with a bit of wiggle room in the front of the shoes. For the 574s, the 7.5 was not uncomfortable but it did have less wiggle room than what I usually feel in my size 7.5s. I tried out size 8 and it was a little bit bigger than my usual 7.5s but a bit smaller than how size 8s typically fit my feet. However, I figured it would be better to have a pair that provides me with more room than less room as I wear it. Either way, it is very comfortable and stylish and would recommend trying out this shoes!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stylish Classics

reviews.text: Wear to work everyday. I like the suede New Balance series. Love the black and white! They are comfortable and stylish. I mix and match my New Balance sneakers all the time. Love pastel colors in New Balance as well.
reviews.title: I have always enjoyed this sneaker.

reviews.text: These are THE best-looking sneaker I have seen in a long time. The "Overcast" color is a beautiful shade of grey that goes with literally everything. Very cool retro look and super comfy as well. I usually wear a 9 1/2 or 10, depending on the manufacturer and style. The 10 was too big, and although the 9 1/2 was the right length, it was too wide for my foot. My foot is not very narrow, in fact, borderline narrow / standard. This is really a 5-star shoe, and I definitely would have kept them, but for me it didn't work because of the sizing.
reviews.title: I loved these, but too wide for my foot

reviews.text: These are my second pair of New Balance - my first pair a few weeks ago were the 840s. I knew when I bought the 574 that they'd be less of a walking shoe - less padding, etc. I do like these very much, just not as much as the 840s. These are a slimmer fit - probably could go up a half size and would be more comfortable. I don't have wide feet and I normally wear a 6.5 but I feel a little stuffed into this shoe. I really like the color and the old school feel of these, and I prefer a darker shoe color combination, which is why I strayed from the 840s (they only come in white, black and beige). These required no break in and I have worn them for several 8-hour work days. I can also walk a fair distance in them, and it isn't that they aren't comfortable, it's just that they aren ... MoreThese are my second pair of New Balance - my first pair a few weeks ago were the 840s. I knew when I bought the 574 that they'd be less of a walking shoe - less padding, etc. I do like these very much, just not as much as the 840s. These are a slimmer fit - probably could go up a half size and would be more comfortable. I don't have wide feet and I normally wear a 6.5 but I feel a little stuffed into this shoe. I really like the color and the old school feel of these, and I prefer a darker shoe color combination, which is why I strayed from the 840s (they only come in white, black and beige). These required no break in and I have worn them for several 8-hour work days. I can also walk a fair distance in them, and it isn't that they aren't comfortable, it's just that they aren't as comfortable as the 840s. I probably will buy these again because they come is so many good color combinations. Less
reviews.title: Like these a lot - different from my 840s
